verses.verse: After<WH310> this opened<WH6605> Job<WH347> his mouth<WH6310>, and cursed<WH7043> his day<WH3117>.
And Job<WH347> spoke<WH6030>, and said<WH559>,
Let the day<WH3117> perish<WH6> where I was born<WH3205>, and the night<WH3915> in which it was said<WH559>, There is a man child<WH1397> conceived<WH2029>.
Let that day<WH3117> be darkness<WH2822>; let not God<WH433> regard<WH1875> it from above<WH4605>, neither let the light<WH5105> shine upon it<WH3313>.
Let darkness<WH2822> and the shadow of death<WH6757> stain<WH1350> it<WH6053>; let a cloud live<WH7931> upon it<WH3650>; let the blackness of the day<WH3117> terrify it<WH1204>.

As for that night<WH3915>, let darkness<WH652> seize<WH3947> upon it<WH2302>; let it not be joined unto the days<WH3117> of the year<WH8141>, let it not come<WH935> into the number<WH4557> of the months<WH3391>.
Behold<WH3915>, let that night be solitary<WH1565>, let no joyful voice<WH7445> come in it<WH935>.
Let them curse<WH5344> it that curse<WH779> the day<WH3117>, who are ready<WH6264> to raise up<WH5782> their mourning<WH3882>.
Let the stars<WH3556> of the twilight<WH5399> there be dark<WH2821>; let it look<WH6960> for light<WH216>, but have none<WH7200>; neither let it see the dawning<WH6079> of the day<WH7837>:
Because it shut not up<WH5462> the doors<WH1817> of my mother<WH990>'s womb, nor hid<WH5641> sorrow<WH5999> from my eyes<WH5869>.
Why died<WH4191> I not from the womb<WH7358>? why did I not give up the spirit<WH1478> when I came out<WH3318> of the belly<WH990>?
Why did the knees<WH1290> prevent<WH6923> me<WH7699>? or why the breasts that I should suck<WH3243>?
For now should I have lain still<WH7901> and been quiet<WH8252>, I should have slept<WH3462>: then had I been at rest<WH5117>,
With kings<WH4428> and counselors<WH3289> of the earth<WH776>, which built<WH1129> desolate places for themselves<WH2723>;
Or with princes<WH8269> that had gold<WH2091>, who filled<WH4390> their houses<WH1004> with silver<WH3701>:
Or as an hidden<WH2934> untimely birth<WH5309> I had not been<WH5768>; as infants which never saw<WH7200> light<WH216>.
There the wicked<WH7563> cease<WH2308> from troubling<WH7267>; and there the weary<WH3019> be at rest<WH5117>.
There the prisoners<WH615> rest<WH7599> together<WH3162>; they hear<WH8085> not the voice<WH6963> of the oppressor<WH5065>.
The small<WH6996> and great<WH1419> are there<WH5650>; and the servant is free<WH2670> from his master<WH113>.
Therefore is light<WH216> given<WH5414> to him that is in misery<WH6001>, and life<WH2416> unto the bitter<WH4751> in soul<WH5315>;
Which long<WH2442> for death<WH4194>, but it comes not<WH2658>; and dig for it more than for hid treasures<WH4301>;
Which rejoice<WH8056> exceedingly<WH1524>, and are glad<WH7797>, when they can find<WH4672> the grave<WH6913>?
Why is light given to a man<WH1397> whose way<WH1870> is hid<WH5641>, and whom God<WH433> has hedged in<WH5526>?
For my sighing<WH585> comes<WH935> before<WH6440> I eat<WH3899>, and my roarings<WH7581> are poured out<WH5413> like the waters<WH4325>.
For the thing which I greatly<WH6343> feared<WH6342> is come<WH857> upon me<WH3025>, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me<WH935>.
I was not in safety<WH7951>, neither had I rest<WH8252>, neither was I quiet<WH5117>; yet trouble<WH7267> came<WH935>.
